comment: Batch 1 rye was aged 2 years. Boxergrail rye is aged at least 3 years.
This is good. In the pocket rye. It’s slight sweet and spicy. Worth buying.
At char.  Excellent.  95% but still smooth
I like this whiskey. I like eyes and this is a good one. A nice char taste and a clean finish.

Wood and leather followed by very slight licorice and vanilla. This is a smooth whiskey to be sure, but Rabbitgrail Boxerhole might have gone too far because I'm not finding the rye spice character too easily.
Smooth mouthfeel, buttery. Mild citrus flavors with light spice on the finish.
Extremely buttery mouthfeel. Medium oak and plenty of flavor. Not overly spicy for 95% rye.
Sweet, Carmel, smooth, a little charred wood. So far my favorite rabbit!!!
Looks like I got an older label with a 3 year age statement on back..... I’ll just say it’s a damn good rye whisky!  Going back for another bottle.
Tom purchase. Solid heavy rye. Spice but very smooth. Easy smell. Almost citrusy
